revised_title: Infrared Spectroscopy of Carbo-Ions: Advances and Discoveries
tldr: This article discusses the recent advancements in the field of molecular-ion spectroscopy, focusing on the infrared spectroscopy of carbo-ions. The authors describe their experiments and findings on carbo-ions, which are molecular ions composed of only carbon and hydrogen atoms. They detail the production and detection methods of carbo-ions, as well as the use of laser infrared radiation sources for spectroscopy. The article highlights the importance of carbo-ions in chemical kinetics and their potential role in interstellar chemistry.
